title: Deep Multitask Learning for Semantic Dependency Parsing
authors:
Peng, Hao  and
Thomson, Sam  and
Smith, Noah A.
venue: Proceedings of the 55th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (Volume 1: Long Papers)
abstract: We present a deep neural architecture that parses sentences into three semantic dependency graph formalisms. By using efficient, nearly arc-factored inference and a bidirectional-LSTM composed with a multi-layer perceptron, our base system is able to significantly improve the state of the art for semantic dependency parsing, without using hand-engineered features or syntax. We then explore two multitask learning approachesâ€”one that shares parameters across formalisms, and one that uses higher-order structures to predict the graphs jointly. We find that both approaches improve performance across formalisms on average, achieving a new state of the art. Our code is open-source and available athttps://github.com/Noahs-ARK/NeurboParser.
